channel.title: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?
channel.description:
Can somebody please give me a quick explanation of how to implement this? I've searched before anyone asks, or if you know of a thread showing this i'd appreciate it!
thanks.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/FHpQXQC.png[/img]

item.title: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?
item.dc:creator: @scampz scampz
item.description:
@scampz wrote:

okay, thanks dude, I’ll have a look but it’s hard to do when you’re not 100% lol.
I thought it’d be something to do with that but didn’t know what to do with it!

Read full topic
item.source: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?

item.title: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Here’s a hint:

if(c.getX() == c.pItemX && c.getY() == c.pItemY) { Server.itemHandler.removeGroundItem(c, c.pItemId, c.pItemX, c.pItemY, true); }
This checks if the player’s x and y is the item’s x and y.
You need to add an exception to that.

And there’s 2 instances of it.

Read full topic
item.source: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?

item.title: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?
item.dc:creator: @scampz scampz
item.description:
@scampz wrote:

at first i thought it was walkingtoitem but then i thought im not walking to it… i could be wrong but i can’t grasp it. im’a take another look.
god it’s so simple lol.

edit: sorry just saw your edit, here:

[code]package server.game.players.packets;

import server.Server;
import server.game.players.Client;
import server.game.players.PacketType;
import server.world.GlobalDropsHandler;
import server.event.CycleEvent;
import server.event.CycleEventContainer;
import server.event.CycleEventHandler;

/**

  • Pickup Item
    **/
    public class PickupItem implements PacketType {

    @Override
    public void processPacket(final Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    c.walkingToItem = false;
    c.pItemY = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
    c.pItemId = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWord();
    c.pItemX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
    if (Math.abs(c.getX() - c.pItemX) > 25 || Math.abs(c.getY() - c.pItemY) > 25) {
    c.resetWalkingQueue();
    return;
    }
    c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
    if(c.getX() == c.pItemX && c.getY() == c.pItemY) {
    Server.itemHandler.removeGroundItem(c, c.pItemId, c.pItemX, c.pItemY, true);
    GlobalDropsHandler.pickup(c, c.pItemId, c.pItemX, c.pItemY);
    } else {
    c.walkingToItem = true;
    CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
    @Override
    public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
    if(!c.walkingToItem)
    container.stop();
    if(c.getX() == c.pItemX && c.getY() == c.pItemY) {
    Server.itemHandler.removeGroundItem(c, c.pItemId, c.pItemX, c.pItemY, true);

     				container.stop();
 			}
 		}
 		@Override
 		public void stop() {
 			c.walkingToItem = false;
 		}
 	}, 1);

    }

    }

}
[/code]

Read full topic

(It checks for it twice)

item.title: Looting a tile next to you that's unreachable?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Pickup ground item
^ Take a look at packet 236

In a PI server you’ll find a class called PickupItem in server.model.players.packets;

Somewhere in that you have a method checking the distance to pick up your items.

Read full topic
